alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 4:52PM EDT until August 10 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Charles County in southern Maryland... Southeastern Prince William County in northern Virginia... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 452 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Dumfries, or near Quantico, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Dale City, Woodbridge, Quantico, Lake Ridge, Montclair, Triangle, Dumfries, Cherry Hill, Independent Hill, Bryans Road, Potomac Heights, Marbury, Ironsides, Rison, Nanjemoy and Pisgah. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
